sequencingFields.description: The percentage of reads containing the alternate allele at a variant site.
The total number of reads covering a variant site.

allelicInformation.description: The phred-scaled version of the CADD score that estimates the pathogenicity of a variant in the human genome.

The PhyloP conservation score is a measure of evolutionary conservation at an individual genomic site. This value is the 46-way PhyloP conservation score that uses the alignments of 45 vertebrate species to the human genome.

The PhyloP conservation score is a measure of evolutionary conservation at an individual genomic site. This value is the 100-way PhyloP conservation score that uses the alignments of 99 vertebrate species to the human genome.

The PhastCon conservation score is a measure of evolutionary conservation that factors in surrounding nucleotides (as opposed to a single base).  This value is the 100-way PhastCon conservation score that uses the alignments of 99 vertebrate species to the human genome.

Mappability is a measure of how unique a location in the genome is based on the surrounding 100bp region. Low mappability may cause issues during alignment and lead to false positives/negatives during variant calling.
The GERP rejected substitutions score identifies sites in the genome that are under some functional constraint measured by the absence of substitutions at the site.
GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the allele frequency in the exome portion of the dataset.

allelicInformation.key: Gnomad Exome Hom alt allele count
allelicInformation.description: GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of homozygous alternate calls in the exome portion of the dataset.

allelicInformation.key: Gnomad Exome Hemi alt allele count
allelicInformation.description: GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of hemizygous alternate calls in the exome portion of the dataset.
GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of alleles called in the exome portion of the dataset.
GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the allele frequency in the genome portion of the dataset.

allelicInformation.key: Gnomad Genome Hom alt allele count
allelicInformation.description: GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of homozygous alternate calls in the genome portion of the dataset.

allelicInformation.key: Gnomad Genome Hemi alt allele count
allelicInformation.description: GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of hemizygous alternate calls in the genome portion of the dataset.
GnomAD is a population frequency database.  This value corresponds to the number of alleles called in the genome portion of the dataset.
This value stores the type of variant (SNV, insertion, or deletion).
HGMD is a database storing germline mutations related to human inherited disease. This value corresponds to the assessment of how damaging the mutation was.
HGMD is a database storing germline mutations related to human inherited disease. This value corresponds to how confident the assessment of the mutation was.
ClinVar is a database storing relationships between human variation and phenotype. This value corresponds to the classification of how damaging a particular variant was.
Ensembl regulatory features contains information regarding if a variant is impacting annotating promoters, enhancers, etc.
This value contains whether a variant lies in a simple repeat or other low complexity region in the genome.

genes.description: The Residual Variation Intolerance Score is a measure of how intolerant to variation a particular gene is in the human genome.
The Genome-wide Haplo-Insufficiency Score is a measure of gene haploinsufficiency calculated in Steinberg et. al, 2015 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkv474}).
This Haplo-Insufficiency Score is a measure of gene haploinsufficiency calculated in Huang et. al, 2010 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1001154}).
Essentiality is a measure of how essential a gene is for humans based on comparison to orthologs in mouse defined in Georgi et. al, 2013 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pgen.1003484}).

variantTranscripts.description: ADA Boost Splice Prediction is a measure of the impact of a variant on splicing using adaptive boosting from Jian et. al, 2014 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gku1206}).
Random Forest Splice Prediction is a measure of the impact of a variant on splicing using random forest from Jian et. al, 2014 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gku1206}).
Meta SVM is a method to predict deleteriousness of a variant in a transcript using Support Vector Machines as defined in Dong et. al, 2015 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1093/hmg/ddu733}).

PolyPhen predicts the impact of amino acid substitutions on a protein.  This is the PolyPhen2 score based on HumVar as defined in Adzhubei et. al, 2014 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1002/0471142905.hg0720s76}).

PolyPhen predicts the impact of amino acid substitutions on a protein.  This is the PolyPhen2 score based on HumDiv as defined in Adzhubei et. al, 2014 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1002/0471142905.hg0720s76}).
PROVEAN (PROtein Variant Effect ANalyzer) predicts where an amino acid substition or indel impacts biological function as defined by Choi, 2012 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1145/2382936.2382989}).
SIFT predicts whether an amino acid substitution impacts protein function as defined by Kumar et. al, 2009 (\url{https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2009.86}).
Effects includes the predicted impact on a transcript such as non-synonymous, possible frameshift, etc.
Affected regions includes the regions of a transcript that are impacted by the variant such as interior coding exon, 5' UTR intron, etc.
